name: Cybersecurity Knowledge Questions
description: A set of cybersecurity-focused questions for cognitive load testing in security contexts

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a common type of malware?
questions.correct_answer: Firewall

questions.text: What does 'SSL' stand for in web security?
questions.correct_answer: Secure Socket Layer

questions.text: Which of these is a common password attack method?
questions.correct_answer: Brute Force

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of a firewall in network security?
options: To monitor network traffic and block unauthorized access
To scan for viruses in email attachments
To create secure backups of data
questions.correct_answer: To monitor network traffic and block unauthorized access

questions.text: Which encryption standard is considered obsolete and insecure?
questions.correct_answer: DES

questions.text: What is a 'zero-day vulnerability'?
options: A vulnerability that has existed for zero days
A vulnerability that is known to the vendor but has no patch yet
A vulnerability that is unknown to the vendor and has no patch
A vulnerability that can be exploited in zero seconds
questions.correct_answer: A vulnerability that is unknown to the vendor and has no patch

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a common network security protocol?
questions.correct_answer: HTTP/3

questions.text: What is the purpose of a CAPTCHA?
options: To verify the user is human
To compress data for faster transmission
questions.correct_answer: To verify the user is human

questions.text: Which of these is a principle of the CIA triad in information security?
questions.correct_answer: Confidentiality

questions.text: What is the main purpose of a VPN?
options: To create a secure, encrypted connection over a less secure network
To scan for viruses in downloaded files
To increase internet speed by compressing data
questions.correct_answer: To create a secure, encrypted connection over a less secure network

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a common method for two-factor authentication?
questions.correct_answer: IP address verification

questions.text: What is a 'man-in-the-middle' attack?
options: An attack where the attacker secretly relays and possibly alters communications between two parties
An attack that targets middle management in organizations
An attack that occurs at the middle layer of a network stack
An attack that happens at midday when network traffic is highest
questions.correct_answer: An attack where the attacker secretly relays and possibly alters communications between two parties

questions.text: Which of these hash functions is considered the most secure?
questions.correct_answer: SHA-256

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of a SIEM system?
options: To provide real-time analysis of security alerts
To scan for vulnerabilities in web applications
questions.correct_answer: To provide real-time analysis of security alerts

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a common web application security vulnerability according to OWASP?
questions.correct_answer: Memory Leaks

questions.text: What is the difference between symmetric and asymmetric encryption?
options: Symmetric uses one key for encryption and decryption, asymmetric uses different keys
Symmetric is faster, asymmetric is more secure
Symmetric works on text, asymmetric works on binary data
Symmetric is used for data at rest, asymmetric for data in transit
questions.correct_answer: Symmetric uses one key for encryption and decryption, asymmetric uses different keys

questions.text: Which of these is a correct description of a buffer overflow attack?
options: When more data is put into a buffer than it can handle, causing adjacent memory to be overwritten
When a system's memory buffer is filled with too many requests, causing a denial of service
When encrypted data overflows into unencrypted memory regions
When network buffers are flooded with too much traffic
questions.correct_answer: When more data is put into a buffer than it can handle, causing adjacent memory to be overwritten

questions.text: What is the principle of least privilege in cybersecurity?
options: Users should be given the minimum levels of access necessary to complete their job functions
Systems should use the minimum amount of resources necessary to function
Security systems should generate the minimum number of alerts possible
Organizations should implement the minimum security controls required by regulations
questions.correct_answer: Users should be given the minimum levels of access necessary to complete their job functions

questions.text: Which of these best describes a 'salted hash' in password storage?
options: A hash function that adds random data to the password before hashing
A hash function that uses multiple iterations to slow down brute force attacks
A hash function that produces shorter output for faster verification
A hash function that works specifically with encrypted passwords
questions.correct_answer: A hash function that adds random data to the password before hashing

questions.text: What is the primary security concern with BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) policies?
options: Lack of control over security configurations on personal devices
Increased cost of providing technical support
Reduced productivity due to personal use
questions.correct_answer: Lack of control over security configurations on personal devices
